oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Church Street West from Sixth Avenue by Night, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1910
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A color postcard of Church Street west as pictured from 6th Avenue, in downtown Nashville, circa the 1910s. The Watkins Institute, as well as the Nashville Railway and Light Company are pictured. The Watkins Institute was established through the philanthrophy of Samuel Watkins, who in his will bequeathed the sum of $100,000 to be used to establish a building to house the Watkins Institute for the education of the citizens of Nashville. The gift was accepted by legislative enactment by the State of Tennessee in 1881. Forms part of the Ridley Wills II Nashville Postcards Collection. 1 postcard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wills, Ridley, 1934-
Watkins Institute; Nashvile Railway and Light Company (Nashville, Tenn.)
